Sentencas: The NiO-samaria doped ceria (SDC) composite powders were prepared by spray pyrolysis technique at temperatures between 400 and 1000 degrees C.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: The variation of the particle structure was investigated by X-ray diffraction (XRD), X-ray absorption fine structure (XAFS), scanning electron microscope (SEM), and transmission electron microscope (TEM)-energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDS).
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: The thermal analysis of raw materials was also carried out.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: The following facts became clear in this study.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: Ceria and nickel have been already separated at 400 degrees C. Samaria is amorphous phase below 600 degrees C, and is dissolved in ceria at 600 degrees C or higher.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: Samaria is distributed uniformly inside the particles before dissolving in ceria.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: The thermal decomposition temperatures of metal nitrate are: cerium < nickel < samarium.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: The results of these analyses were explained without contradiction.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique

Sentencas: It was found that it is important to optimize the state of liquid drop before thermal decomposition in order to control the microstructure with this type of particle.
Titulo: Study on pyrolysing behavior of NiO-SDC composite particles prepared by spray pyrolysis technique
